content.question: The function <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> shown in the figure above is continuous on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma x sub 6, close bracket " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and differentiable on the open interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0 comma x sub 6, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="x sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, <math alttext="x sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, <math alttext="x sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, <math alttext="x sub 4" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, <math alttext="x sub 5" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, and <math alttext="x sub 6" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> are points on the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis. Based on the graph, what are all values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that satisfy the conclusion of the Mean Value Theorem applied to <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma x sub 6, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="x sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> only, because this is the value where <math alttext="g of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> equals the average rate of change of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma x sub 6, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="x sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> and <math alttext="x sub 4" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> only, because these are the values where <math alttext="g prime of x, equals 0 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>â€²</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> on <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma x sub 6, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>.

<math alttext="x sub 1 " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> and <math alttext="x sub 5" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> only, because these are the values where the instantaneous rate of change of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at those values is equal to the average rate of change of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma x sub 6, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>.

<math alttext="x sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, <math alttext="x sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, and <math alttext="x sub 5" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> only, because these are the values where either the instantaneous rate of change of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at the value is equal to the average rate of change of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma x sub 6, close bracket " overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> or the value of <math alttext="g of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is equal to the average rate of change of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma x sub 6, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="x sub 1 " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> and <math alttext="x sub 5" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> only, because these are the values where the instantaneous rate of change of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at those values is equal to the average rate of change of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma x sub 6, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
